noun.description: The time or a period of time following the moment of speaking or writing; time regarded as still to come.
examples: we plan on getting married in the near future
work on the building will be halted for the foreseeable future

adjective.description: At a later time; going or likely to happen or exist.

phrases: she would be more careful in future
I would like to fine him for the Diver Lifeboat Fund and to warn him to be more careful in future.
I need hardly add that this particular young wretch will be taking the train or walking in future.
Maybe he won't be so quick to be a pawn in someone else's chess game in future.
Recommendations will be made to the school about the way they conduct SATS in future.
origin: Late Middle English: via Old French from Latin futurus, future participle of esse be (from the stem fu-, ultimately from a base meaning grow, become).
